conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D change when light source moves forward.
Image shows a small lamp, a cookie or pastry, a pink dessert on a plate, an object at the bottom, and a chocolate dessert with a cherry on top.
All objects are suspended above a wooden surface with shadows cast below them.
When light source moves closer to objects, shadows become smaller and move closer to being directly underneath their objects.
Shadow A will become smaller and move closer to being directly under the lamp.
Shadow B will become smaller and move closer to being directly under the object.
Shadow C will become smaller and move closer to being directly under the plate.
Shadow D will become significantly smaller and move closer to being directly under its object.
All shadows will decrease in size and move closer to being directly beneath their respective objects.
The amount of change will be proportional to how far each object is from the surface.
Effect reduces perspective distortion causing shadows to be enlarged and offset when light source is at an angle.
